content.description: Thin face climbing down low then past a horizontal crack to a small ledge with a short bit of crack to finish.
content.protection: Minimal protection - most will toprope or solo.
content.location:
The face between

Double Crack

and

Toe Jam Express

.

content.description: Starts as double cracks down low and transitions into a nice crack that is a good exercise in crack climbing. Short but quality and worth doing to develop or hone your jamming skills.
content.location:
Between

Up to Heaven

and

Steady Breeze

.

content.description: Tight shoes may help on this one! Do a boulder problem start, like many on this rock, and weave your way up the face using edges, scoops and a couple of horizontal cracks.
content.protection: Very little if leading, you might be able to wiggle in some gear (1-1.5") in a horizontal near the top but most will solo or top-rope this route.
content.location:
Located between

Chockstone Chimney

and

Double Crack

.

content.description: Flaring crack at the bottom that opens up the higher you climb. If top-roping, take long slings.
content.location:
The crack just to the left of

Morning Warm-Up

.

content.description: A bouldery start on edges quickly eases to lower angled friction moves and a committing sequence of smears at the very top, especially if soloing.
content.location:
Between

Toe Jam Express

and

SOB

.

content.description: At the far right end of the Short Wall, practically around the right hand end, climb up a 'flake' to a slab crux, moving up and left to join the 5.3 finish of Donna T's Route.  The crux is getting into the traverse.
content.protection: I soloed it, but if memory serves, it appeared that you could protect just before the traverse- in which case take some nuts or small cams?A crash-pad or spot would protect the lower moves.

content.description: A tricky sequence right off the ground is the crux, which quickly eases and more moderate, enjoyable climbing gains the top.
content.protection: Very little if leading, perhaps you can get some gear (1.5") in a horizontal near the top but most will solo or top-rope this route.
content.location:
Located between

SOB

and

Afternoon Shakedown

.

content.description: This rotue is a crack just left of Donna T's Route that terminates not far above the ground. Climb the crack and shoot for the top directly upward. The climbing might be a little easy at the grade. But the crux is high and would be bad to fall from!
content.protection: A crash pad and a spotter or TR.

content.description: Wander up the low-angled lumpy face passing several horizontal cracks to a crux at the very top where the angle steepens.
content.protection: Minimal gear available in the horizontals but most will toprope or solo.
content.location:
Just right of

Linda's Crack

, a wide crack.

content.description:
The chimney left of

Linda's Face

is a good wide crack exercise if so inclined.
content.protection: Gear to 6+ inches but most toprope or solo.
content.location:
The wide crack just left of

Linda's Face

.

content.description: Climbs the center of the face following along a faint seam feature. Erosion at the base is noticable and this has gotten more difficult over the years.
content.location:
Between

Afternoon Shakedown

and

Right N Up

.

content.description: Fun jamming on this route that climbs a straight-in crack and about midway up switches over to another crack on the left.
content.location:
Located between

Tight Shoes

and

Up to Heaven

.

content.description: Way too short, but the best warm up of the short routes at the wall's right edge. Go to the right-most edge of the S. Face of the wall, then walk back left to the first crack system encountered. Probably more like 5.4, but it's hard to guess at that grade. Too short to be great. Too bad it's not a full pitch in length.
content.protection: A few cams, or a crash-pad.

content.description: Very easy climbing/scrambling that's more often used as a down-climb than not.
content.protection: Gear to 3 inches, although most will solo this climb.
content.location:
The obvious wide crack between

Linda's Face

and

Tight Shoes

.

content.description: The last face route on the right side of the Short Wall. Easier than it looks and a fun route.
content.protection: Large cams/hexes in the crack to the left.

content.description: The hardest route on this portion of wall, this tackles a thin boulder problem start then eases up and offers fun face climbing to the top.
content.location:
Between

Morning Warm-Up

and

Gotcha Bush

.
